alert.note: Alert for Grant Grove Area; Kaiser to Rodgers Ridge; Kings Canyon NP; Sequoia NP; South End of the Upper Sierra; Upper San Joaquin River; Yosemite NP outside of the valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 25 at 2:00AM PST until March 01 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON ABOVE 8000 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON ABOVE 2000 FEET... * WHAT...For the Blizzard Warning above 8000 feet, blizzard conditions. Additional snow accumulations of 8 to 20 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. For the Winter Storm Watch above 2000 feet, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 18 inches possible above 2000 feet and 2 to 5 feet above 4000 feet. Winds could gust as high as 65 mph. * WHERE...The Sierra Nevada. * WHEN...For the Blizzard Warning, until 4 PM PST this afternoon. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Sunday afternoon through Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Strong winds could cause tree damage. The cold wind chills as low as 30 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
